III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was assaulted after Thanksgiving by other youth at the
facility and sustained a broken nose. There was another incident
2

in October where youth was assaulted and sent to the hospital.
Youth is scared that when another youth returns to the facility from
a home visit, they will be physically assaulted once more. There
are concerns that youth is being targeted and staff are unable to
keep youth safe.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed face to face on January 3, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker and reported they had no
further information.
Director and Assistant Facility Administrator (AFA) were
interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3, 2024,
separately in collaboration with DHHS Worker. AFA reported
Youth C got caught with a cell phone and destroyed the house.
AFA stated Youth A has the option to call her worker when she is
triggered as a coping technique, so Youth A called the number her
worker provided for after hours. AFA reported the number Youth
A was given was to Centralized Intake, not to a worker to talk
about how Youth A was feeling and to support Youth A for being
triggered.
Director stated there have been safety plans created for Youth A
due to the incidents with other youth in the home. Director
described the first incident at the end of October starting over
Youth A and Youth D arguing about who was going to use the
phone first and the second incident occurred weeks later with
Youth B. Director stated she spoke with Youth A on November
29, 2023, and Youth A did not express feeling unsafe since the
incidents and told Director she wanted to stay at the facility.
Director reported December 2, 2023, Youth A started integrating
back into events and coming off the safety plan.
Director described leadership being more visible on the floor
during shifts to help newer staff, staff being vigilant watching youth
and staff positioning themselves on the floor to stop the behavior
before it starts and gets out of control. Director reported staff
separate youth who are not getting along by having them on
different floors within the house or different locations, so they are
not around one another, but the house only has so much room.
Director stated staff are sitting in on group therapy with the youths
discussing calming/coping skills for each youth to have a better
understanding of each youths’ needs. Director reported being
proactive making staff more involved.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
being at the front of the house in the early morning standing with
3

Youth A while Youth A was fixing the material on her wig. Staff 1
stated Youth A and Youth B were having issues that morning
saying things to one another. Staff 1 reported she was standing
with Youth A the entire time when Youth B approached, went over
Staff 1’s back and started punching Youth A. Staff 1 described
being in the middle of Youth A and Youth B and all of them falling
to the ground. Staff 1 reported Youth B grabbed Youth A’s hair
and continued to attempt to punch and kick Youth A. Staff 1
stated she tried to protect Youth A the best she could by body
blocking the hits from Youth B and telling Youth B to stop and to
let go of Youth A’s hair. Staff 1 reported it happened very quick
with no indication it was going to happen. Staff 1 stated she
definitely could not have predicted the situation. Staff 1 stated
Staff 4 was in the kitchen making breakfast and came to assist.
Staff 1 reported Staff 4 was able to verbally de-escalate Youth B
and get Youth B to step away. Staff 1 stated she believed the
entire incident lasted about six minutes. Staff 1 described once
Youth B moved away Youth A stood up and Staff 1 walked with
Youth A to the back bathroom. Staff 1, who is also training to be
the medication technician for the facility, examined Youth A and
noticed underneath Youth A’s eyes bruising was developing and
Youth A’s nose was starting to swell. Staff 1 could not recall if
Youth A’s nose was bleeding or not. Staff 1 took Youth A to the
emergency room (ER), then to the police department because
Youth A wanted to press charges on Youth B, then returned to the
facility. Staff 1 stated a safety plan was developed prior to
returning to the facility and Youth A agreed to the plan once
returning. Staff 1 reported all the youth in the home make smart
comments to one another every day. Staff 1 stated there was no
indication Youth B was going to attack Youth A. Staff 1 stated
Youth A was using a pair of scissors to cut the material of her wig
and Youth A told other youth in the house she threatened Youth B
with the scissors. Staff 1 denied hearing Youth A threaten Youth
B with the scissors and stated she was standing next to Youth A
the entire time. Staff 1 stated the facility was in ratio and felt they
had enough staff to cover the situation. Staff 1 reported she does
not feel Youth A is targeted or the victim as Youth A does a lot to
instigate the other youth in the facility. Staff 1 denied any youth in
the facility are targeted. Staff 1 stated youth will argue with each
other one minute then a short time later be fine with one another.
Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B seem fine now, there are no
issues between the two and the safety plan in no longer in place.
Staff 1 reported she was not employed at the facility when the first
incident with Youth A occurred October 2023.
4

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
reported being at the facility for almost one year and not feeling
comfortable and being threatened by the youth in the house.
Youth A stated she was knocked unconscious once and had her
nose broke. Youth A described at the end of October getting into
an argument with Youth D about using the phone. Youth A stated
she was escalated so she went outside with Staff 2 to calm down
and Youth D ran out the back door while Youth B and Youth C
came outside on the porch to see what was happening. Youth A
stated Staff 3 was verballing telling Youth B and Youth C they
needed to go back inside but they were not listening. Youth A
stated she “warned” Youth C and reported, “I went after her.”
Youth A described Youth B and Youth C leaving the porch and
attacking her. Youth A reported Staff 2 or Staff 3, she could not
remember, were trying to keep Youth D away from her but Youth
D was able to get around staff. Youth A reported Staff 2 stood
there using words to de-escalate the youth.
Youth A described getting her nose broke by Youth B punching
her in the face. Youth A reported standing in front of the mirror in
the front hallway of the facility doing her hair and cutting material
on her wig. Youth A stated Youth B was “beefing” with her all day
and threatened to “beat my ass.” Youth A reported Staff 1 was
standing next to Youth A and told Youth B to stop. Youth A
described Youth B telling Staff 1 to shut up then moved behind
Staff 1, grabbed Youth A’s hair, and starting punching Youth A.
Youth A stated it happened “very fast and [Staff 1] could not stop
[Youth B].” Youth A stated Staff 4 came to help but just stood
there. Youth A reported Staff 1 was covering her stating she was,
“over me like a blanket.” Youth A stated Youth B got a couple of
hits on her, stopped and walked away. Youth A could not recall if
Staff 4 said anything during the incident. Youth A reported she
got up and went to the bathroom. Youth A denied any staff
checking on her or calming her down after the incident. Youth A
stated she had to tell staff she needed to go the hospital. Youth A
reported she does not feel safe when youth start tearing up the
house. Youth A stated her plan is to remove herself from the
situation. Youth A reported staff move kids downstairs, to their
rooms and separate the youth when something like that happens.
Youth A stated there is not much more staff can do to make her
feel safe, that they step in and try to stop the situation. Youth A
reported she has talked with her worker and told her worker she
wants to stay at the facility to finish drivers training and school.
5

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
described an incident where Youth D knocked Youth A
unconscious. Youth B stated it started with Youth A throwing a
phone at Youth D then Youth D throwing a hairbrush at Youth A.
Youth B reported Youth A went outside, picked up bricks and
threatened to beat up Youth C. Youth B stated she was on the
porch with Youth C trying to calm Youth A. Youth B described
Staff 2 and Staff 3 being outside trying to de-escalate Youth A.
Youth B reported Staff 3 was talking with Youth A trying to get her
to stop throwing items at Youth B while Staff 2 was stopping Youth
D from running up on Youth A. Youth B stated Youth C got
involved by leaving the porch and going after Youth A trying to hit
her. Youth B reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 did intervene trying to
break up the fight.
Youth B described an incident involving Youth A standing at the
mirror with scissors with Staff 1 standing by her. Youth B stated
Youth A was saying, “I’m gonna stab these bitches.” Youth B
reported she ran up on Youth A after Youth A came at her. Youth
B stated she grabbed Youth A’s hair and started fighting while
Staff 1 stood in the middle. Youth B described Youth A, Staff 1
and herself falling to the floor and Staff 4 coming to assist. Youth
B stated she let go of Youth A and walked away. Youth B denied
hitting Youth A in the face. Youth B reported Staff 4 just stood
there. Youth B could not recall if Staff 4 said anything or not.
Youth B described staff at the facility as “pretty chill” and verbally
work to calm youth down. Youth B stated staff do try and intervene
and described staff stepping in between youth if youth start
walking toward one another to fight.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at Mt. Pleasant Middle
School on January 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Youth C refused to discuss the incident of Youth A being
knocked unconscious. Youth C stated staff try and break up youth
and prevent “stuff” from happening. Youth C described staff
separating youth by taking some downstairs or to different spots in
the house. Youth C reported staff will intervene and not just sit,
then stated some staff do just sit, but would not provide staff
names or any other details. Youth C stated not everyone listens
to staff, so staff will just try and keep that youth away from
everyone else. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility and
not feeling like the staff can do anything more to keep youth safe.
Youth C stated she was done talking and asked to leave.
6

Youth D is no longer at the facility and was interviewed via
telephone on January 10, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Youth D stated she is now in “lock up” due to the
incident with Youth A. Youth D described Youth A throwing a
phone at her then Youth D throwing a brush at Youth A. Youth D
stated Staff 3 got by her, and Staff 2 stood next to Youth A. Youth
D reported she moved away from Staff 3 and started hitting Youth
A. Youth D described Staff 3 taking Youth A outside to separate
them, so Youth D ran out the back door. Youth D reported Staff 2
chased after her and said, “everywhere I moved he moved.”
Youth D described Staff 3 being in the front of the facility with
Youth A. Youth D stated Youth A grabbed the “gutter thing and
tried to throw it at me.” Youth D reported she was mad, so she
tried to find things to throw at Youth A, but Staff 2 kept stopping
her. Youth D stated Staff 3 was trying to stop Youth A from
throwing things but was not doing a good job. Youth D reported
Youth C went after Youth A and Staff 3 tried to stop Youth C.
Youth D stated everyone was fighting and Youth C kicked Youth A
in the head. Youth D stated staff tried to step in and do what they
could. Youth D stated Staff 3 and Staff 4 step in between youth to
stop them from fighting but Staff 6 is not always consistent, she’s
more verbal. Youth D reported Staff 5 came into the facility to
help because of the situation at the house. Youth D stated staff
do a good job calling extra staff when needed.
Staff 2 no longer works at the facility and resides in a
different state. Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on
January 12, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2
described Youth D being upset and wanting to use the phone
Youth A was using. Youth D started antagonizing Youth A and
Youth A became upset making comments to Youth D. Staff 2
reported Staff 3 took Youth A to a different area in the house to
de-escalate her when the other youth in the house started
antagonizing Youth A. Staff 2 reported he told Staff 3 to take
Youth A outside to separate from the other youth in the house.
Staff 2 stated Youth D threw a brush at Youth A. Staff 2 reported
immediately Staff 3 and himself stepped between the youth. Staff
2 stated he took Youth A outside but kept looking in the windows
to see where Youth D was at in the house. Staff 2 reported Staff 3
was inside with Youth D attempting to de-escalate her. Staff 2
stated he saw Youth D move past Staff 3 and run toward the back
of the house. Staff 2 reported he knew Youth D was coming out
the back of the house and around to the front to get Youth A.
Staff 2 described he stood in front of Youth D, kept verbally trying
to de-escalate her but Youth D got around him and continued after
Youth A so Staff 2 placed Youth D into an upper torso restraint.
7

Staff 2 stated Youth A was throwing rocks, picked up a chair from
outside and threw it at Youth C who was on the porch with another
youth (Staff 2 could not recall who) and with Staff 3. Staff 2 stated
Youth C then charged at Youth A. Staff 2 reported he was still
trying to de-escalate Youth D and Staff 3 was trying to stop Youth
A and Youth C from fighting. Staff 2 stated he let go to assist Staff
3 and get Youth C away from Youth A who was now on the
ground. Staff 2 stated he was working to verbally de-escalate the
youth and so was Staff 3. Staff 2 reported he was in two or three
restraints during this incident trying to keep the youth from
assaulting each other. Staff 2 stated the facility was within ratio
and tried to keep the incident from escalating. Staff 2 reported
there were either five or six youth at the house and two staff. Staff
2 stated having more staff would have helped the situation and
extra staff were contacted to come in and help. Staff 2 reported
threats were made by the youth, staff separated the youth, and it
should have been effective. Staff 2 stated staff did everything
they knew how to do and are trained to do but it just was not
enough.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on January 17, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at
the facility with the youth. Youth E reported she was gone on a
home pass during both incidents with Youth A. Youth E stated
there are time staff are outnumbered by youth and staff do not
know how to deal with the destructive behavior, staff just verbally
tell them to stop. Youth E reported there are always staff present,
but they cannot control more than one youth at a time who is
escalated. Youth E stated Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 7 step in and
keep youth safe. Youth E reported it is better when Staff 5 is not
around. Youth E reported Staff 5 refused to bring her medication
to her upstairs in her room when she had kidney stones. Youth E
stated she was made to go downstairs in the medication room to
get her medication. Youth E stated Staff 5 talks “shit” to youth and
hypes youth up (investigated in 2023C0000798SI).
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on January 17, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at the
facility with Staff 3. Staff 3 stated she was working the day
Youth A was knocked unconscious. Staff 3 reported there were
five youth and two staff on shift. Staff 3 describe Youth A and
Youth D getting into an argument about the phone, Youth A
throwing the phone at Youth D and then Youth D throwing a
hairbrush at Youth A. Staff 3 stated she attempted to take Youth
A into a different room to de-escalate the situation, but the girls
stepped toward one another, so Staff 2 took Youth A outside and
8

Staff 3 stayed inside with Youth D to de-escalate her. Staff 3
reported Youth D kept trying to get outside to Youth A while Youth
C was hyping Youth D up. Staff 3 reported Youth D ran outside
and started chasing Youth A while Staff 2 worked to keep Youth D
away from Youth A. Staff 3 stated she went outside to assist, and
Youth B and Youth C stood on the porch. Staff 3 reported Youth
A and Youth D were trying to push past Staff 2 and herself to get
to one another while throwing objects at one another and yelling at
each other the entire time. Staff 3 stated Staff 2 was able to get
Youth D to calm down and move to the side of the house but then
Youth B and Youth C started instigating Youth A. Staff 3
described Youth C leaving the porch, going after Youth A, and
hitting her. Staff 3 stated she restrained Youth C but then Youth B
got involved and started to hit Youth A. Staff 3 stated Staff 2
came to assist and get Youth B away from Youth A who was on
the ground. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 was able to separate the
youth and get them back into the house while Staff 3 stayed with
Youth A. Staff 3 denied Youth A and Youth D being assaultive
toward one another prior to this situation. Staff 3 stated there was
not a safety plan prior to this incident. Staff 3 reported the youth
will say things to one another but “simmer down soon after.” Staff
3 stated she has thought about that incident a lot and feels she
and Staff 2 did the best they could and tried many different things,
but the youth were not receptive to the redirection. Staff 3
reported staff are well trained and get support from management.
Staff 3 stated in that situation extra staff was called for support as
well as law enforcement.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on January 17, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at the
facility with Staff 4. Staff 4 described making breakfast while
Staff 1 was with the youth. Staff 4 reported she heard yelling so
went out to the living area and saw a struggle between Youth A
and Youth B with Staff 1 in between the youth. Staff 4 stated
Youth B had a tight grip on Youth A’s hair, so Staff 4 did not want
to do an upper torso to move Youth B because of Youth B pulling
Youth A’s hair. Staff 4 reported she kept talking with Youth B,
reminding her she had a visit with her sister later that day. Staff 4
stated Youth B let go of Youth A’s hair, hit her then walked away.
Staff 4 reported she called Director and AFA to report the fight and
asked them to come to the facility. Staff 4 stated AFA had been at
the facility but left to pick up Staff 5 because Staff 5’s car broke
down. Staff 4 stated Youth A kept saying her nose was broke so
she was taken to the ER. Staff 4 described Youth A’s nose being
swollen but could not recall if it was bleeding. Staff 4 stated Staff
5 arrived at the facility, checked out Youth A and agreed Youth A
9

needed to go to the hospital. Staff 4 reported the whole incident
lasted about five minutes. Staff 4 denied anything going on
between Youth A and Youth B leading up to the event. Staff 4
stated Youth A and Youth B were allowed to be around one
another but they did not interact much. Staff 4 reported the facility
was in ratio and would have had extra staff if Staff 5’s vehicle had
not broken down and AFA leave to pick up Staff 5. Staff 4
described being a newer staff but feeling comfortable on shift.
Staff 4 stated she had interacted with the youth but had never
seen them escalated or act that way. Staff 4 reported when she
entered the living area and saw what was going on she reacted
within ten seconds. Staff 4 stated she felt comfortable working but
at the time scared. Staff 4 described Staff 1 as putting her body
between Youth A and Youth B and trying to protect Youth A. Staff
4 reported they did the best they could in the situation. Staff 4
stated maybe having more experience staff it would have been
different.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on January 17, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at
the facility with the youth. Youth F described Youth A throwing
a phone at a youth, Youth F could not recall what youth, then
everyone yelling at Youth A and getting upset. Youth F stated
Youth C and Youth D “clicked up” together and started yelling at
Youth A. Youth F reported Youth A was trying to swing on Youth
D so Staff 3 placed Youth A in a restraint and took Youth A
outside away from the situation. Youth F stated Staff 2 stepped in
front of Youth D and Youth D ran out of the house. Youth F
reported Staff 3 was outside with Youth A trying to keep Youth A
separated from Youth D. Youth F stated Staff 2 was trying to
keep Youth B and Youth C from getting to Youth A. Youth F
reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 were the only staff on shift with five
youth. Youth F stated staff were trying to keep the youths
separated but three of the youth ganged up on Youth A.
Youth F described sitting on the couch while Youth A was using
scissors by the mirror to do her hair. Youth F reported Youth A
stated, “I could really stab some bitches in this house.” Youth F
reported Staff 1 was next to Youth A because she had scissors
and told Youth A to stop. Youth F stated Youth B heard this,
became upset and ran up on Youth A. Youth F stated Staff 1 was
not ready to deal with this, had been trained but not ready. Youth
F reported Staff 1 verbally tries to break it up, does really well
trying to verbally de-escalate but Youth B gets by Staff 1 and
“plows into Youth A’s face.” Youth F reported Staff 1 tries to
protect Youth A’s face and calls for Staff 4 to assist. Youth F
10

stated Staff 4 comes out and says “guys stop, stop guys” trying to
verbally get them to stop. Youth F described Staff 4 being slow to
react but “lots better now.” Youth F reported liking all the staff at
the facility. Youth F stated staff do a good job keeping youth apart
who are not getting along but it is hard because the house is
small. Youth F denied staff instigating youth and reported staff do
their jobs at keeping youth safe. Youth F stated things happen to
Youth A because of Youth A.
DHHS Worker does not have any findings in the investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There are no disciplinary reports
and Staff 1 completed Safe Crisis Management 11/14/2023
- 11/16/2023.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There are no disciplinary reports
related to restraints and Staff 2 completed recertification
Safe Crisis Management 10/12/2023.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There are no disciplinary reports
related to restraints and Staff 3 completed recertification
Safe Crisis Management 10/12/2023.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There are no disciplinary reports
and Staff 4 completed Safe Crisis Management 10/25/2023
– 10/27/2023.
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Reports 166230214, 166230215, and 166230212 from
incident on 10/28/2023 for Youth A and Youth D were
consistent with staff and youth interviews.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Reports for
incident on 10/28/2023 involving Youth A, Youth B, Youth C
and Youth D. The incident reports are consistent with staff
and youth interviews.
• Isabella County Sheriff Office report 23-002467 for incident
on 10/28/2023 involving Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and
Youth D. Police report is consistent with staff and youth
interviews. Police report reads, “It should be noted that
even through [Youth A] is listed as the victim, she was also
an aggressor in the incident.”
• Safety Plan for Youth A dated 10/28/2023 lists a phone
number for Youth A to call if needed, Youth A will not be left
alone with any youth in the facility, she will not share a
bedroom with Youth B, Youth C or Youth D, she will identify
a New Hope staff member that she feels safe with and be
able to contact them at any time, and the Director will have
contact with Youth A throughout the rest of the weekend to
11

assure she is feeling safe. The safety plan for Youth A was
signed and dated by all staff.
• Safety Plan for Youth A dated 11/25/2023 lists a phone
number for Youth A to call if needed, Youth A will not be left
alone with any youth in the facility, she will not share a
bedroom with Youth B, or sit next to Youth B and will
identify a New Hope staff member that she feels safe with
and be able to contact them at any time.
• Director shared group text messages between staff, daily
management meeting notes and log sheet entries
indicating Youth A was integrating back into group, allowed
to interact with the youths she had physical altercations
with and discussed with Director she was feeling
comfortable at the facility. The text messages indicated on
11/4/2023 the first safety plan was ended.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report for incident
on 11/25/2023 involving Youth A and Youth B. The
incident report is consistent with staff and youth interviews.
• Isabella County Sheriff Office report 23-002809 for incident
on 11/25/2023 involving Youth A and Youth B. Police
report is consistent with staff and youth interviews. Police
report describes reviewing footage of incident and reads,
“In the footage I could see [Youth B] attack [Staff 1] and
[Youth A], [Youth B] then pulls them to the ground and the
fight moves to the living room, [Youth B] then stomps and
punches [Youth A] in the face, and pulls [Youth A’s] hair
while staff attempt to stop the attack. [Youth B] eventually
stops and walks away.” Video was not available for
DHHS Worker and I to review as the incident was over
30 days ago and no longer saved on tape.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based upon interviews with
multiple youth and staff describing staff intervening appropriately
to redirect youth and physically intervene to keep Youth A safe.
Technical Assistance:
It was recommended to the facility to have a clear end date listed
on safety plans.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
12

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
